intro: Sphaeranthus suaveolens var. tetraphyllus, commonly known as the four-leaf sphaeranthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, while its flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in groups. This variety is distinguished by its unique four-leaf structure, which is rare within the species.
